code.codeSystemName: Personal Relationship Role Type Value Set

value.displayName: Propensity to adverse reactions to drug
Propensity to adverse reactions to drug
Propensity to adverse reactions to drug

list.item: Recurrent GI bleed of unknown etiology; hypotension perhaps secondary to this but as likely secondary to polypharmacy.
Acute on chronic anemia secondary to #1.
Azotemia, acute renal failure with volume loss secondary to #1.
Hyperkalemia secondary to #3 and on ACE and K+ supplement.
Other chronic diagnoses as noted above, currently stable.

text.paragraph: Alert and in good spirits, no acute distress.
This patient was only recently discharged for a recurrent GI bleed as described below.
He presented to the ER today c/o a dark stool yesterday but a normal brown stool today. On exam he was hypotensive in the 80?s resolved after .... .... ....

Lab at discharge: Glucose 112, BUN 16, creatinine 1.1, electrolytes normal. H. pylori antibody pending. Admission hematocrit 16%, discharge hematocrit 29%. WBC 7300, platelet count 256,000. Urinalysis normal. Urine culture: No growth. INR 1.1, PTT 40.
He was transfused with 6 units of packed red blood cells with .... .... ....
GI evaluation 12 September: Colonoscopy showed single red clot in .... .... ....

act.text: Possible flu-like symptoms for three days.
Possible flu-like symptoms for three days.
Possible flu-like symptoms for three days.

code.displayName: Tetanus and diphtheria toxoids - preservative free
code.originalText: Tetanus and diphtheria toxoids - preservative free

translation.displayName: Tetanus and diphtheria toxoids - preservative free

act.text: Possible flu-like symptoms for three days.

tr.td: 0.09 MG/ACTUAT inhalant solution, 2 puffs QID PRN wheezing

substanceAdministration.text: 0.09 MG/ACTUAT inhalant solution, 2 puffs QID PRN wheezing

list.item: THORAX & LUNGS: Clear without rhonchi or wheeze.
ABDOMEN: No distension, tenderness, or guarding, obese, pos bowel sounds.
BACK: Normal to inspection and palpation, without tenderness; no presacral edema.
EXTREMITIES: Doughy edema bilaterally, chronic stasis changes, no asymmetrical swelling.

tr.td: Liver Functions and Other Laboratory Values

text.paragraph: Patient denies recent history of fever or malaise. Positive for weakness and shortness of breath. One episode of melena. No recent headaches. Positive for osteoarthritis in hips, knees and hands.
